summary: The Superior National Forest Restoration Act of 2025 aims to revive mining activities in the Superior National Forest in Minnesota. It mandates the rescission of a prior land order, requires timely review of mine plans, and directs the reissuance of canceled mineral leases and permits. The bill allows for new preference right leases and permits for surface land use, defining the Secretary responsible based on the specific land unit. This bill seeks to streamline processes and restart mineral extraction in the specified area.
